abstract: Bank of America has agreed to pay $26 million to settle charges that its securities unit published fraudulent research reports on companies and failed to prevent leaks of reports that were used for improper trading, federal regulators said Wednesday. With the settlement, Bank of America becomes the last bank to settle an industrywide inquiry into possible conflicts of interest between analysts and bankers and ends a six-year investigation into the company’s misuse of its own analysts’ research.
